Reviews.Title: “Odd having 2 separate hotels in one overall hotel.”
Reviews.Author: aimmi081
Reviews.Content: The service was quite decent and although the rooms were kind of drab and old, they were clean for the most part. But the fact that the location was really not good for sightseeing in Rome and the lack of working air conditioning (I was on a Contiki trip and some of the other people on the trip said theirs was) and adequate ventilation made it not a hotel I would ever recommend or stay at again, which ends up being unfortunate, since the hotel service people were quite nice. Food was questionable though.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Stars Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Igor M
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the great localization. It's just a few meters away from a subway station. The rooms are not a four star standard, the breakfeast is really poor and if you wake up late you won't have much to eat. The staff is polite and the bathrooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Bad & Sad”
Reviews.Author: Karin181
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with a very reasonably priced flight & hotel deal and hoped for the best when we saw the hotel website. Upon arrival we were greeted in a very unfriendly manner. Instead of "hello, ciao, whatever..." the concierge just yelled "Austria???" and pointed to the room were we were to drop our luggage - well, it was afternoon and our rooms were not ready. When asked when our room would be ready, the concierge answered "don't know, problem". When I started to call the travel agency, we were suddenly told the room would be ready within 1 hour. Our room was big but rather run down - veneer and wallpaper peeling, stains on carpets, bath had a moldy smell. At least the air condition was working and the water pressure was ok. Our friends ended up with rooms in the same condition, but substantially smaller. I think the Hotel is 30 years past it's prime and nothing has been done since. Breakfast was not good, coffee was instant brew, scrambled eggs tasted of plastic. We found a nice bar across the street and had breakfast there. Bus and subway around the corner at least.

Reviews.Title: “Thats old Italy for you”
Reviews.Author: Marie D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at regent last year while Contiki'ing it around Italy. this was the first stop of the tour and first stop in Italy ever. This is my family town, and boy was i surprised, but it was built a while ago and unless you stay in a top notch place, all of italy is kinds like this. well other hotels, bathrooms in cafe's and stuff like that. All these pictures bring back sooo many memories, especially the broken hair dryer one!! I think that was my room as well!! So here is the low down: your not getting hilton or ceaser's palace here. for the night you will spend sleeping, its actually not that bad. yes the rooms are a bit dated, but everyting in italy is. the one thing is that there are no bed bugs,, now that would really bite! yes the paint is chipping and wall paper might be peeling, but its old. breakfast in the morning is actually quite good, but your in italy, everything is!! it was quite clean and the food was very fresh. staff is pretty quiet. if your italian they are more outgoing with you, i guess that was a bonus for me. but they tend to anything you need as wel as caling a cab for you or what not. the metro is steps away. its one of the brightsides to this hotel becuase the train ride is cheap and literally 2 mins away from the main city and about 25 ish mins (train changing incld) to the colusieum. there are are also a few small shops on the same street like little bakery to grab a mortadella paninno, a cafe to grab un espresso e uno biscotti, as well as a mini bar called 'carrots'. to be honest, for what you pay, which isnt much a night, i think $90 (well last year at least), its not bad considering its other perks. yes beds are a bit hard but overall, its ok. its not dirty, just outdated and they dont want to re-glue things, so what! you are not sleeping in filth. there is a full length mirror in the closet. I realized it when i was just leaving. as well, you need to leave a key in the ac unit constantly so make sure you get 2.

Reviews.Title: “Great as a basic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LauraExplorer22
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here twice in June, and we were pretty happy with it. Basic rooms, wifi available (for a price) and relatively quiet rooms. We were pleased with both our rooms, however we were lucky, because when we visited some other friends rooms - there's weren't as good as ours - with the wifi dropping out, noises at night etc. The location isn't the best, however it's only a few steps away from a train station with a direct line to Via Del Corso - which is a brilliant shopping strip. We recommend the bar "Carrot" around the corner for a drink or dinner, we frequented it quite a few times and is worth the trip! Oh, and we'd avoid the restaurant in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely not be back during Summer!”
Reviews.Author: vthomas1234
Reviews.Content: While the stay in the hotel was not altogether unpleasant with a large room, the air conditioning was almost non-existent. I complained during all my 5 days of stay with temperatures of 30 degrees+ regarding the AC not working. It may have worked for a few hours during the entire 5 days! While the reception did their best to fix the problem, there was not much they could do since it was a mechanical issue - and the technician never turned up. They did not even provide a FAN!! Also the mattresses were horrible and uneven and the springs made a lot of noise! Among the receptionists, Donna was the most helpful and spoke excellent English. While the breakfast was good it got boring due to repetition of the same dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Quaint”
Reviews.Author: Jmast0626
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Europe for 2 weeks with our best friend and were part of a Contiki tour. We stayed here for 3 nights. Its a bit out of town but thankfully we either had a coach to take us in and out of town or took the bus. The rooms were a bit outdated but clean and all rooms had a small balcony overlooking a small square. The hotel was right across the street to a convenience store/small bar. The bathrooms were clean and VERY small and to be quite honest a safety hazard. You had to be very careful getting out of the shower.. but overall we enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and helpful staff, but VERY LOUD!”
Reviews.Author: Pink_Lady78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in May of 2011, as part of a Contiki Tour. I had read horrible reviews before we left., so I was quite worried. However, when we arrived, I was surprised to find that the hotel room was clean and safe, which was all we were looking for. We were a little in sorts when we first arrived getting adjusted to our surroundings. The hotel staff was very helpful. I did leave with only one complaint. It is horribly LOUD at night. There are many night spots around this area and therefore the noise is very bad. Based on this, I would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: macgyver3
Reviews.Content: The room on the ninth floor was terrible.the walls are cracked,the bathroom is full of fungus and everything was dirty.also the elevator stops at 8 floor and had to go with the luggages throuth the steps.the door was burgled and the windows had no safety on locking,to be exact there was no locking at all at the windows. after a lot of argument they changed as at the other day at another floor that was busheled. the new room was a little better but nothing close to 4 stars hotel

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: missyb_11
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews here I was expecting the worst, but the room we had was better than I expected. It was clean and everything worked (plumbing, tv etc). We only stayed for 2 nights and it was a nice place to come back to at the end of the day to sleep. We found some of the staff to be a bit rude - looked at us in disbelief when we asked where the in-room safe key was and said that we needed to pay a deposit for it (as though we should have already known). The breakfast spread was quite nice - lots of yummy pastries. Overall it was a nice place to sleep and have our breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “OLD ROOMS BUT GOOD FOOD”
Reviews.Author: Mariko_Yogi
Reviews.Content: The rooms were old and the wall and ceiling looks torn. It is located abit outskirt, so we paid more than usual (usual means the price to the city centre) to the cabby from the airport to the hotel. The receptionist is helpful. The breakfast is good. We had our dinner there too. I would say the food is the best! There is a train station just outside the hotel which you can get to shopping areas. But overall i would say its not a four star hotel, rather a three star standard, this is overrated.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid”
Reviews.Author: AlJonAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in May 2010. Upon arriving we noticed that there was a slight smell in our room so we opened the window to air it out a bit. When we came back after dinner around 10pm the smell was so horrible that we both were almost physically sick to our stomachs. It was so bad that the people staying next door to us felt so bad for us they offered for us to stay in their room instead (which did not have any smell at all). We ended up staying in the room however the double bed was two singles pushed together (which is very common in Europe I will admit) but they were very old beds both of which had a ditch in the middle so we both ended up sleeping in the crack between the two beds. Breakfast was good, dinner ok, and the other rooms I saw were fine just a bit outdated. When we were there, there were about 5 schools staying there also. I couldn't believe that they would allow children to stay in a "five star" hotel in Rome. Turns out they were on a school CAMP!!! They stayed up until all hours and I know a lot of people were disrupted by them running up and down the stairs and screaming. AFter the children left it was a lot better. I think that this hotel is a bit of a lucky dip - it could be ok, or it could be HORRID!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cemozBrussels
Reviews.Content: This hotel having 4 stars must be one of the Italian miracles. It is not even a 2-star hotel. Everything is as old as you can imagine and filthy dirty. There is no service at all. Yes the rates are low, but then they sell a small size local beer for 4 Euros (just go to the next door local pizzeria, where you can buy a double size beer for half the cost), and you have to wait 15 minutes for that. They sell internet for 6 Euros a day, which did not work for the last 48 hours I was there. There is practically no insulation. Sleeping is difficult because of the noise coming from the street and also coming from the youngsters staying at the hotel. During the 4 days I stayed there, they never cleaned the shower cabin. Avoid this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Marsha, Marsha, Marsha”
Reviews.Author: TravelingOYEster
Reviews.Content: My pictures can tell the story the best. I arrived a day before my friend. I got a single room (decorated by Florence Henderson). It overlooked pigeon poop and cigarette butts. The hairdryer cord was ripped in half. My door didn't shut properly and the safe didn't work. The next night I got a double once my friend arrived. The sink screeched at us and the toilet wouldn't stop running. We didn't choose this hotel - it was part of a tour. When we ended in Rome, we got a different room - this time the beds were sunk and my back hurt like hell! Also - there is NO internet. Apparently there are problems - but I started and ended here and after 2 weeks it still wasn't fixed.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel smells like a sewer.”
Reviews.Author: StarBrigt7
Reviews.Content: The Regent Hotel and the beautiful city of Rome were our last stop on a very long tour of the Mediterranean. Unlike most of the hotel rooms on our lengthy trip, this one was actually rather large and the bathroom was quite clean. That's where the positive ended. When our tour bus pulled up at the curb, the bus sounded with a chorus of sighs of relief. After some of the hotels we'd stayed in up to that point, this one looked like heaven on the outside. Unfortunately, the minute we opened the door to our room the nightmare began. First was the roar coming from the air conditioner. The sound was so loud that I was certain the thing was going to explode any minute. After we'd been inside for about ten minutes, I noticed the room smelled of sulfur. Throughout the remainder of our stay at the hotel the smell got worse. It was so bad I had trouble sleeping at night (although the sound emanating from the a/c didn't help too much either). The Hotel Regent isn't really conveniently located, there's no free wifi and the breakfast buffet is nothing to rave about. Overall I'd say that unless you enjoy the smell of sewer, STAY AWAY! --

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Karin32
Reviews.Content: For Rome standards the deal was quite good. The Regent is not in the center but with the train it's only 2 stops to the Spanish Steps or 15 min with the 910 bus to Termini station. The hotel has sure seen better days - in the 70/80ies and since then not much has been changed. Bath and AC were working ok, beds way too soft, our backs were suffering. Breakfast ok, instant coffee not drinkable. Across the street on the corner to Euclide square is a new bar serving wonderful Illy coffee and fresh pastries - do it Italian style and have your coffee and cornetto there! When we arrived, we were treated incredibly rude. No greeting, the consierge just yelled "Austria, room not ready till 4, put luggage in here". During our stay we had further "friendly" encounters with this man - even eye rolling and making faces when we asked where the breakfast room was. Other staff members at the desk were nicer. We'll be back to Rome, but will spend a bit more and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “ok - but you must be able to overlook some things”
Reviews.Author: akl74
Reviews.Content: The hotel has some good and bad qualities. Location is fine, service friendly, breakfast was decent (maybe because I stayed away from the greenish-looking curdled eggs. Cappuccino & latte macchiatto with croissants was truly great though). Our room was quiet despite the groups of youths who were checked in at the same time. Can really not complain of any noise. AC worked just fine, in fact we had it turned off because it got too cold. We slept well at night and the beds were just fine, mattresses were good, possibly new. The hotel is quite run down, as is apparent on the furniture which showed big dents and scrapes in the wood of the tables and night stands. One really wonders what people did in those rooms to damage the furniture thus. Cleanliness is a big minus. One constantly had the feeling of uncleanliness there, which shouldn't happen in a 4.star hotel. The carpeted floor in our room was quite dirty. Big red stain in front of my bed. I told myself it was merely the spill of a reddish looking drink. On my more pessimistic days it looked like a gigantic blood stain... Bathroom: huge greenish water stains on the floor of the shower, and yellowish stains in the toilet made the whole bathroom appear unclean. Also kind of funny that the shower did not really have any doors to close, so the water kept spilling out on the floor. Caused a flood every time one showered. All in all, if one manages to overlook those things one can have a relatively OK stay at the hotel. Not a great experience, but not terrible, either. After all, one goes to Rome to see Rome, a city of superlatives! - not to stay in the hotel all day.

Reviews.Title: “A four stars hotel?? Maybe 20 years ago!”
Reviews.Author: minettobia
Reviews.Content: I traveled alone for business and I needed internet connection for my job. I choosed this hotel because on the web site there was a mention about internet connection included in room's facilities! IT'S NOT TRUE! You have to pay minimum 6 € per day! When I complained to the Director with a letter, he ignored my complain. Anyway, the hotel has a very poor standard. The building is old, the rooms are crumbling and the environment noisy. The breakfast was so poor that only a naive tourist can accept this standard from a 4 stars hotel with that rates! I was supposed to stay a week: I left after 2 days! I will never come back again!

Reviews.Title: “With some quality, but far from everthing”
Reviews.Author: FMikel
Reviews.Content: The Hotel needs some general update and it is not linked directy with the rest of the city (best way is by bus, but the train is 50 meters away) because of limited scheduls, and frequency. Breakfast is shared with the Ritz of Rome (with the same 4*) and marks many points (a 5 stars breakfast; The staff is friendly and gives usefull help, but only if we ask. At night the surroudings are very dark, with a bar and a pizzaria near by, we forget the sensation of, after 22h, "beeing in a island".

Reviews.Title: “More than Three but less than four”
Reviews.Author: edmass
Reviews.Content: Our room was quite large for European standards, AC available but not needed at this date in Rome. One of the large windows could be opened and blinds, drapes could be adjusted. Lots of room for storing and hanging clothes and a good sized desk/dresser with a tiny fridge. The walls of our room were covered with padded fabric – nice touch. Two single beds pushed together with barely adequate mattress. Lots of signs of faded grandeur and indifferent maintenance around the place . For example, elevators that creaked and moaned, nasty water stain in tub and a shower head that shot jets of water in every direction, a room key card that had to be reprogrammed twice. No fun to come back to your room after a long day tramping around Rome and being unable to get in. Breakfast was filling but most of our party complained about the quality. I had no problem filling up on scrambled eggs and sliced ham with decent bread and borderline croissants. But, breakfast was served until 10 AM and the basement room was bright and clean. What more does a guy need? The elevators creaked and moaned but we never waited more than a minute or two for one to come by and there is none of the button overkill one sees in American models these days. The staff functioned pretty much the same as the elevators, grumpy but the job got done. On the other hand, when we asked a desk clerk/concierge about reservations to the Borghese Gallery she went right to work, made reservations, and told us all about getting the 910 bus at a stop 20 feet from the Hotel door. The hotel is in a reasonably posh neighborhood but isn’t close to the heart of the tourist sites of Rome. There are, however,a couple of very affordable eating places on the same block as the hotel and at least one very good restaurant a couple of blocks away. I imagine you get more and better food for the money here rather than in hotels closer to the main tourist areas. There is a train station (Euclide) a short block from the main hotel entrance. After a short ride to the next stop (end of that line) you exit to the street and walk maybe 50 feet to the entrance to the Rome Metro (subway, tube, T). The Metro takes you to most of the sites in a quick two or three stops. All for a ticket with unlimited transfers (for 70 minutes) that costs one Euro. The Metro is better than London but not as good as Paris. You shuffle around a bit but routes are well marked, escalators worked, trains ran frequently, and the atmosphere was never scary. Thus the problem of the Hotel Regent being a bit far from the center of Rome is negated by the way it fits into the Rome public transportation network. Perhaps people staying only 1 or 2 nights in Rome would be better served by staying closer to downtown but we were there for a week and could afford to spend a little time on trains. We booked through Durgan Travel out of Boston so I can’t comment on the value of the Hotel Regent because we don’t know how much Durgan paid for our room or how much a comparable room might cost. All I know is that the package was pretty reasonable so the room probably didn’t cost all that much.

Reviews.Title: “Good size, decent stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: msukevtrip
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights, was booked by our tour group. A few general things about European hotels I've learned on my travels: - all tend to be small - don't pull the cord in the shower, it supposedly signals an alarm to the front desk for help - walls are thin - I still don't know how to use that other bowl shaped sink-faucet thing next to the toilet The inside of the hotel looked elegant and classy, but a bit run down. It probably looked better a few years ago. Some of the fabric wall paper was ripped off the wall and the carpet looked worn. However, the size of the room was pretty large compared to most European hotels we stayed in. One thing I didn't like was the toilet placement next to the sink. It was cramp in the corner right up to the sink, I had to carefully angle my way to using it. It was also odd that the shower head was on the side of the tub rather than the end. The staff was nice and helpful. However, we had the 'Do not Disturb' sign up and they still cleaned our room. They actually threw away one of our toiletry items too. On a positive, the morning breakfast was a large dining hall with lots of food selection. The location was pretty good for being far away from the center of Rome. It was near a metro stop so it was easy to get to and from the city. Overall, all the little negatives I mentioned did not ruin the trip, but I guess I won't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: TG09
Reviews.Content: I stayed on my own for 2 nights. My room was big and the bathroom more than adequate and a big plus was that it had airconditioning. The staff were very helpful and spoke very good english. The breakfasts were ample The location is good, but not the best. It is 1 stop on the overland from Flaminio tube station. When I was there the station next to the hotel was closed so I had to get off at the following station and walk- not ideal, but also not too bad. The station is supposed to be open in October. The other thing is that the trains don't run that often, especially at night so if you want to stay out past 11 then it means catching a cab. That said it was very good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Watta Rippa Offa”
Reviews.Author: Spakka
Reviews.Content: Classic Italian Job here. Rooms are old and in dire need of refurbishment, but that won't stop you paying over the top for it. Mattrases were so worn that you actually slept in a little concave dip in the middle of them. Shower curtain mung of dampness and was covered in fungus at the bottom. Small fridge was at room temperature due to a burst condenser that got dangerously hot. On the plus side, the breakfast was massive and varied, but the scrambled egg was a disgrace. There's a good fast food shop around the corner, but ask the price of things first or the guy'll rip you off in the kindest of manners. All in all, to get the best value out of this place, take a polythene bag and empty plastic drinks bottles to breakfast and fill them with supplies to keep you going through the day.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel we stayed at during our 2 week adventure...”
Reviews.Author: kIaihC
Reviews.Content: Terrible. They have absolutely no shame to display 4 stars at what obviously is a 1 star establishment. The staff are rude, the beds are old, the carpets are moldy and the walls could use a new coat of paint. Plus the air-conditioning was not working. When we called up to complain they brush us off by saying it takes awhile to "warm up". After sweating out way thru the first night, we decided to move out the next! Absolute rubbish. Originally went along with this hotel due to group bookings but looking back, should have just gone with the poor reviews and tried elsewhere. Hotel Mimosa (a modest B&B) in the centre of Rome was the 2nd hotel we moved to and it's 100% better!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare.....”
Reviews.Author: jeffayn
Reviews.Content: Its a 4 star hotel from appearance but I had to give this hotel a bad name the reason is because they give me a room where the bed is broken. So everytime I sat on the bed and make a heavy breathing while lying on the bed, it squeak the hell out from it. For 3 nights I have to sleep so tight and so stoned that I am half tire after I wake up each morning. The second thing is the air condition. It early may and I am all sweating in the room. I call to the reception, they said is working and its ok. I had ask them to come over for continuous 2 nights and they say the same thing : Its working fine I am not blind or feelingless, the air duct got not even a breeze from it. Thanks it just early May and by opening up the windows, my room is all air conditioned again. The location is very good indeed, just few step away from the rail, but the broken bed and not working air conditioner and poor hotel service quality... I have to give a NO go to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “do not touch it with a barge pole!”
Reviews.Author: briddiver
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a four star hotel to celebrate her birthday, we will certainly remember it for all the wrong reasons. We arrived at the regent and were promptly sent down the corridor to book in at the adjoining Grand Ritz, the desk staff gave us a room and told us to go to the restaurant for breakfast. The room was on the fifth floor reached by one of two lifts licenced for six people. The room itself was about ten feet square overlooking the street and had a small bathroom which had definitely seen better days. The window was single glazed, very loose and had a drop down wooden shutter. The first night was spent listening to the local boy racers spin wheels and race round the adjoining square, Saturday night was like being in the pits at an F1 race with a few motorbikes thrown in, the noise level dropped at around 3.30am. Breakfast,we attended the restaurant and were sumarily sent to a basement area with several hundred other guests. Over the next three mornings we were exposed to drinks stations with no cups, juice machines with no juice, scrambled eggs some mornings not others, tinned fruit cocktail, one morning with only de-frosted sliced bread as the sole bread option, not a toaster or any other warm item in sight. We eventually complained and were allowed in the restaurant which was as we expected but with only seats for about 30 people it is obvious what the management strategy is. We witnessed guests asking to have a dirty table cleared so they could sit down to be told by the young man parading in a suit that it was not his responsibility. Locked and chained fire doors, smell of drains, surly unhelpful staff, I could go on. The upside daily linen change, right next to the train station one stop to Rome, cheap tickets and frequent trains. Great Pastoritto restaurant next door and cold beer and good pizza at Alex's next to the entrance. A special weekend ruined by one of the worst hotels we have ever been in

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back again!”
Reviews.Author: Mottram23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not inconveniently placed to view Rome being very close to a railway station that has you in Rome within 5 minutes. Having said this, in my opinion, that is all it has to offer. It is listed as a 4 star hotel, never! Our first room had the black out curtains hanging off the rail, the windows (which were suppposed to be double glazed ) had cracks in them, there were no plugs in either the bath or hand basin, the towel rail was very loose,a lamp shade was missing from the bedside lamp and there was a awful smell in the bathroom. Why we did not change immediatly I do not know but perhaps being British we decided to "make the best of it" and the smell in the bathroom did seem to dissipate. When we returned to the room after out evening meal, however, the smell had returned with a vengeance so we decided enough was enough and went to the reception to complain. They said they would send a technician to investigate. This turned out to be somebody dressed as a porter carrying a fresh air spray which he used in the bathroom telling us the smell would be gone in 5 minutes. At the end of this time the smell began to return so once more we contacted reception who once again said they would send somebody to investigate. The second person also arrived with a spray and this time he did not get off lightly. We pointed out all the faults in the room and he agreed that we should change of room but that nothing could be done that night as the hotel was full. We,therefore, spent the night with the bathroom door firmly shut listening to school children in other rooms shouting to each other via the windows, which they could open. Apparently we were told that the hotel is often used for large parties of children. In the morning we were given a new room and the hotel did move our things for us. Compared to the original room the new one was great and even had a balcony! It was, however, not without its faults. For example the bathroom door knob came off if pulled too hard, the shower doors wobbled and threatened to fall off their runners if not closed with extreme caution and the bed was not very comfortable having a mattress that was too big for the base. Still, compared to the other room this was paradise. We were booked into this hotel as part of a choir who were sing in in Rome. I was a bit concerned when I read the reviews for this hotel on TripAdvisor and the reviews were certainly correct, How this hotel can be classified a 4 star is beyond me and I would now advise people to avoid it like the pague.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is not 4 star do not be fooled”
Reviews.Author: Anapopo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in what were lead to believe was a 4* hotel but given the price we expected 3*. The walls are paper thin there were tour loads of Spanish school children staying there too. You could hear them running up and down the corridors all night and shouting from their rooms at each other. The children where not kept to one floor but dispersed among the regular hotel guests and allowed to run a muck. The rooms themselves were basic but the bedding was changed every day and fresh towels. When i tried to complain about the noise, I was ignored by the staff. The women simply carried on filling paper work. The place could be tolerated if the staff were friendlier, when i asked for the manager I was sent from one person to another all of whom denied any responsibility. Finally it is some distance from the city of Rome but its not difficult to get into the town. Avoid the kids .and the snotty

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel although a little out the way”
Reviews.Author: travelcat22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Regent last July and found the hotel to be great. Clean, spacious rooms. No tea/coffee facilities in room, but that didnt bother me. There are two lifts up to the hotel rooms so you dont have to take the stairs. Breakfast was lovely, pleanty to choose from and tasty. Hotel staff we found to be very friendly and all spoke English, however a little Italian always goes a long way. The only down side to this hotel is it's location, it's a little out the way and you need to get the tube everyday to get into the centre. We got a 3 day pass which you can buy at the tube station. Also we found there we no resturaunts nearby so ate at the hotel every night, this wasnt a problem as the food was lovely, a great choice and not too overpriced, but it would've been nice to eat out at least once. Rome is a fantastic city and I would love to go back, I would certainly consider this hotel again, but would try to find one of a similar standard a bit closer to the main attractions. That said, we didnt have a problem with the tube and it's probably the best way to see the whole city if you only have a few days. Hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: “Average 2 Star Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MichaelByrne
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an average 2-Star Hotel. The room was clean and reasonable. No tea/coffee making available in the room. The lifts were very small. All the tv channels were in Italian- none in English. Had trouble with the room cards not working and a few others on our group had the same problem. In the winter- the warm air-conditioning can be turned off but not turned on to cool the room down. In the summer (I was told) the cool air-conditioning can be turned off but not turned on to heating if the room is cold. Cheap system. The staff in the hotel were hit and miss- one person hung up the phone on me when I rang from the room, while another lady in reception couldn't have been more helpful. The breakfast each day was just okay with sliced ham, cheese and salmon. Also a selection of breads, cereals etc were available. Up the road and around the corner past the subway station is a cheap and cheerful pasta place PASTARITA (they are part of a chain). Reasonable pizza's and pasta about 5 to 12 euros a dish. We used it once or twice, as we ducked the hotel restuarant. Rome anyway is full of pasta places, so why get ripped off by the hotel? To the left out the hotel entrance is another tiny pizza place, which does takeway and sells bottled water. The subway was 1 euro per trip or 4 euros a day. Keep the hotel card with you, because sometimes the taxi drivers don't know the hotel as it is a bit outside the centre. Once they had the name, they all used GPS to navigate there. About 8 or 10 euros from Trevi fountain to hotel depending on traffic. If the pope is at home, his public audience is on Wednesday and his celebrates mass on Sunday mornings. Enjoy Rome and just use the hotel to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “This is not Four star!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hawx
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Regent for three nights. Our stay was riddled with problems on the first night. The shower head was covered in limescale and the shower doors were broken, one of with swayed from side to side. The ceiling was rotten and the general decour of the room was somewhat lacking. We requested to change rooms and after sending a workman to check the shower, reception agreed to do so. We were taken to the new room upon arriving to the room the staff could not open the door with the electronic key, after subsequent trips to and from reception the workman opened the door manually. We took our luggage into the room and were then told we had to change rooms again! Our third and final room was of a much better standard, the shower head was directly over a bath and was very volitile. We would honestly say this hotel is no more than a three star. Location wise the regent was also lacking, it was too far out to be on any of guide book maps and definately too far to walk into the city centre. The metro station was only 2minutes away but was not a mainline and closes at 10:30pm. A taxi ride from the airport to the hotel will set you back 45-50 euros we strongly advise you to take the shuttle bus which costs 6 euros per person. On the positive side, the staff were very friendly and the breakfast, whilst limited, was tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Good Priced, Nice Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kvc85
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights from 2nd to 4th Nov 2007. The room was very large with kingsize bed plus single bed, tv and minibar, nice sized clean bathroom with toiletries and hairdryer, bed linen and towels cleaned each day. The breakfast was a very nice continental style, plenty of food choice and waiters kept replenishing the food throughout . The breakfast service was buffet style from 6.30am til 10.30am and the waiters were efficient in seating you and clearing away dirty plates. One mistake was to walk from the termini to the hotel thinking it wouldn't take long, I advise you to take a taxi for this first journey as its very easy to get lost! There is a metro station just 500 yards to the right of the hotel which for 1 euro will take you to the next stop (2 mins journey) just over the road from the spanish steps, from there everything is walking distance. We never ate in the hotel restaurant of an evening, why would you want to when the best pizza and pasta is 2 minutes away in the centre of Rome? Definately a good hotel overall, the cost of room included the breakfast and as this was just a last minute budget break i did not mind the metro ride in for the sake of cheaper room rates, the hotel is clean, and staff are helpful.

Reviews.Title: “OK but awful service”
Reviews.Author: Eric096
Reviews.Content: The hotel was part of a triple centre Rome Florence Sorrento deal. Location 1km from city centre is ok, but in August everything was closed - we couldn't even eat nearby - we had to go into town. Our room was fine, though we heard of others that were not. In general (not just here), Italian service is awful. Receptionists don't deign to look at you, no-one carries your bag, and breakfast was all made with very cheap products. I think Italians believe a lot of marble means 4 star. It doesn't.

Reviews.Title: “WORST hotel I EVER stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: TravelOrUs
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel as part of a tour group, and having read reviews I was already anxious about staying here - with good reason! This is one hell hole of a hotel. Our flight was delayed, and there was no catering, peanuts, snacks nothing - at 11pm!! The lobby looks impressive, but there are TINY lifts, barely enough for one person with suitcase, and they smell bad. The carpets are sticky with dirt, and the rooms are small, which I could deal with, but dangerous, and ill-equipped. My room's windows were nailed shut (health & safety), there were silverfish insects in the shower tray, and worst of all the electrical fittings were hanging off the wall, photo attached. When pointed out to staff, I was shouted at by the RUDEST male receptionist I ever had the misfortune to meet. The breakfast included tinned fruit cocktail, and reconstituted scrambled egg, with pastries as sides. Thankfully, I was only there 2 nights, as I could not be further relocated, having already refused the first room they tried to fob me off with. Truly, truly horrible. Worth NOT recommending.

Reviews.Title: “Never thought a hotel could be this bad”
Reviews.Author: tarbara
Reviews.Content: The worst part of the hotel is the staff. I honestly never thought hotel staff could ruin an experience until I stayed here. They atrociously rude and inhospitable. When we were leaving, we had them call a cab for us because we were VERY late for our train home (the train station is way across town and we had 25 minutes). The receptionist coldly told us that it would arrive in ten minutes. We waited outside and after about three minutes another taxi passed by which we flagged down for a ride. As we were about to get in to the cab the receptionist ran out and physically blocked us from entering the taxi. He told the taxi to leave and forced us to wait outside the hotel doors so the staff could watch us and told us it would be 15 minutes before our taxi got there. After five minutes another taxi passed by, which we flagged down... same story. He screamed at us that the hotel would have to pay ten euro if the taxi arrived and there was no one to take it. We pleaded with him (my friend even started crying she was so worried) to let us take the taxi because we were going to miss our train but he would not relent. Finally, THE taxi arrived and took us to the station. We caught a glimpse of our train as it left the station. It might have cost the hotel ten euro but it cost us 250 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: MSLancashire
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Regent and can't believe the reviews we have just read. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly and told us about the metro station down the road which was a God send. Our room was excellent as was the breakfast. Where are these people coming from with their comments? The hotel was very clean and our room was perfect. Not old and in need of refurbishment!! We have travelled the world and this hotel is a 4*!! Don't let these yanks put you off!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ulinamy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary and we were very pleased. We had no problems. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews about the shower, staff, etc. We found the rooms clean and cozy. The big window in the room was wonderful to look out of. The breakfast was good and filling. The location was great, in a quiet neighboorhood. We walked everywhere from the hotel. It gave us a chance to see different apartments and shops that we wouldn't have seen if we took a bus. There is a really good restaurant around the corner called Pastarito. The servings are huge and fresh and well priced (6-10 euros for the pastas). Overall we had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not good value for money, although I'll give a pass to the Regent.”
Reviews.Author: superlopez
Reviews.Content: Knowing upfront that the Italian 4 stars are simple Spanish 3 or even 2 stars, our expectatives were not high, which helped not to feel too disappointed. The beds needed new matressess. They are not too confortable as we felt the springs on our backs in several parts. The room was clean and warm except for lots of dirt in the windows. The bathroom was average, nothing exceptional at all. Bath and shower. A bit noisy, not too iwell solated. A couple of nice restaurant and cafe nearby, with the ferrovia station at 50 meters, where you can take trains to Piazza del Popolo and be there in 15 minutes. The breakfast was good, but don't expect eggs, bacon and toasts (no toaster!) or warm food. In summary, not too bad for 5 days, but not what a traveller can expect for a 4 stars. Couldn't we have standard ratings in the EU?

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Worth the $”
Reviews.Author: LordW
Reviews.Content: We made the order on the hotel website, no problem there. Easy, quick and not expensive for a 4* hotel in Rome. The hotel itself is very clean, the rooms have all the needed facilities - safe, mini-bar, air conditioning, satellite TV, enterernce with electronic card, etc. Rooms are small but very comfortable, the only problem there was that there was no bath but a shower. Breakfast is simple yet good, and overall very good return for cash. The hotel is located in a very nice neighbourhood, not exactly in the center (about 40 minute walk from the main sites) but to get to all the main sites in Rome it's about 10-15 euro taxi fare, virtually nothing. Enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT stay at the Hotel Regent!”
Reviews.Author: MrT43
Reviews.Content: I was part of a touring group that just returned from Rome. We stayed at the Hotel Regent and the staff was so arrogant and unaccomodating, that I vowed to write a TripAdvisor review upon our return to the States. I have stayed in beautiful hotels and many Super 8s as well, so my main concern in lodging is cleanliness and comfort. The Hotel Regent is old, but fairly clean. The real problems we had was with comfort. Rome is quite hot in July and after a day's tour of the city one only longs for a cool night of sleep. We could not get the staff to turn our air conditioning down to a level that we could even fall asleep! Complaining did no good and the front desk staff was so surly it made me scared to ask again (this was after callling five times the night before). The last night I finally soaked small towels in cold water and laid them across my bare chest so that I was cool enough to fall asleep. They probably figured that since we were part of a group there was no need to make us happy. The hotel is not in a central part of the city so it makes it hard to shop. There are plenty of restuarants close by that were good. We were there when there was a taxi strike, so we were rather stuck. The beds were awful, as were the pillows--like rocks. The morning breakfast was passable, but the coffee terrible. I would STRONGLY advise anyone to NOT stay at this place if you can avoid it. I don't care if it was a good deal--one needs to be comfortable and be able to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant and ignorant-wannaby receptionist”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: OK hotel but an arrogant reception guy. First day we asked for directions to go to the spanish steps and was told the only way is by taxi or a 40 min walk.So we took the extra 40 min walk both ways. We asked specific on buses or trains. Next day we found out our selves that there is a train station just outside the door (you can hear the trains from the dinning room). When we asked there were no other people and no language problems wich he tried to excuse himself with when I confronted him next day, acting very arrogant.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was clean but old and worn out. Could use some remodeling. The service was fine. The staff was courtious. The hotel is not close to the city center but there is a subway station about a block away. Not what I would call a 4 star hotel. I don't think I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: GTRambler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a group on a package. Had two rooms. They were clean, though the furniture was old and a bit worn. In one room the shower did not drain well and in the other the overhead light did not work all the time. I think we were told the room was about85 euros a night, but we don't know for sure. The hotel is not in city center and not on the metro line. It has a seperate train that runs to it and that does not run as late as the metro. The neighboorhood is nice, but there is not much to do there so you will be paying for transportation back into the city. A taxi from St Peters to the hotel is about 10 Euro. The food in the hotel was the highlight. We ate dinner there 4 nights and had great meals. I agree that it is hard to see this a 4 star hotel, but if it is cheaper than most it may be worth the money. Our service there was fine and it seemed oriented towards large groups.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: shirls_19
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome at the start of september and i stayed in the Regent Hotel. I had booked the hotel before i had read any reviews, and after a read the reviews i thought my friend was going to kill me for booking it!! the hotel is located outside room but because rome's transport facilities are good we did no find this a problem but saying that we were always back at the hotel before ten so i cannot comment beyond that. We stayed on the sixth floor of the hotel, our room looked like the picture that is shown of the blue interior and glass pane over the beds. the shower and bathroom were both cleaned every day but the only grievance had with the shower was the actual shower door. to be honest you won't want to carry to much weigh becausei had to take deep breaths before i got in!!! the air conditioning worked in our room thank god. also the beds were comfortable. the only thing i could complain about was our room was very close to the left and you could hear i going up and down during the night but i slept like a log after all the walking around room. there is a bar accross the road with seats outside and it was really nice. Around the cornor from the entrance to the regent hotel is a chinese resturant-the food was lovely and the price was very good. the staff were friendly and helpful when we checked in and they proved us with any information we needed about getting around room and gave us a map. the food in the polo bar was nice i never ate in the other restuarant because the meau was full of fish. the place were i flet the otel fell down on was the breakfast, it actually looked horrible- it entailed ham and cheeses and ceral and lots of bread- the room that the breakfast is in was not very clean and there was a fly crawling over the bread the one morning i did go down for breakfast so i was completely turned off from that point, but lucky for me i don't really eat breakfast. how to get the hotel regent? well i travelled with ryan air so we landed in cimpino airport which is outside the city. ryan air sell tickets for their own bus into the city but they charge eur13 return which is fine but you can get the local bus from the bus stop outside the airport for eur1 and eur1 for you lugage. the bus takes about forty minutes and leaves you at the first stop on the metro line to termini and this only costs a eur1. when you get on the metro go to the stop called flamino and get off the metro there and go outside of the metro station and turn right and there is a green building and this is were the train to the regent goes from. the train line on the left hand side is the line that is used. it is the first stop called elulade. get off the train and walk up the steps up to the street and take your right and there is telephones on the walls and a news stand and then you turn right and your there! N.B. the train ticket is valid for all the metro lines and the local train to the regent and the buses around rome. i hope this helps somebody and have fun in rome it is such a fab cit can not wait to go back next summer

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price but nothing impressive”
Reviews.Author: medved73_2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as it was booked by our tour operator. It was ok, rooms were decent size (for Europe) and clean enough. We did not have any problems with hot water in the shower although the stream of water was not that strong and it took me a while to wash my hair. The stuff overall was polite but not extremely. We did have an encounter with one waiter once, when we ordered the bottle of wine at dinner and waited for a long time to get it and when asked him again, were told we never ordered anything. Breakfast was fine exept juice was not good, but I liked the coffee and the pastries. The location is fine although not as close to city center as I would like. It was a little noisy from the street traffic but we were so tired, we did not really hear anything. The view from our room was great (we stayed on the 9th floor). Oh, one little detail, the elevator only goes to eight floor and it was quite a challenge to take our luggage using the stairs to the ninth floor. The rooms could use new furniture and carpet but well.. Overall, the stay in this hotel did not spoil my impression of Rome but I probably will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go There!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very noisy with many students on spring break and not controlled--running up and down the stairs and yelling out the balconies. Manager was rude; barman was nice. Beds are hard as rocks and pillows lumpy. OK breakfast and very tiny shower. Very loud street noises all night and 6:00 AM garbage pickup--even on Saturdays. We had trouble with phones also and there were no instructions in rooms or times listed for services. Inconvenient location too--the "metro" at Euclide has difficult steps for the disabled. It is very far from the four stars it advertises on its website and property. I would never recommend it to anyone, especially during holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Keep away from this misery”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Regent Hotel 8 nights (15-22/01).There is a list of severe deficiencies: 1) Regarding breakfast: I WAS ONE OF THE WITNESSES OF THE ULTIMATE DISGUST: SMALL COCKROACH ARRIVING FROM AMONG THE TOAST SLICES...Old coffee pots with cracks. Some kind of liquid trying to imitate orange juice. Maybe diluted orange flavoured pill, i do not know. 2) In the first room we stayed, there was terrible noise from outside. Having a shower proved to be a nightmare since the the water flooded as the hole was clogged...We asked to change room. 3) In the second room, STILL NOISY, the bathroom was ok but the air conditioner was not working properly and the atmosphere was uncomfortable, not cozy at all. The beds had only a single thin blanket and u couldn't get warm during the night. The water in the shower was warm (in the evenings only, see below) but not hot. So having a shower was made out of personal hygiene, the pleasure of a hot bath was completely out of the question. IN THE MORNINGS THERE WAS NOT EVEN LUKEWARM WATER(!!!) 4) Browsing pay tv channels is charged. There is no notification that u are charged. In decent hotels it is clearly stated that if u want to see a pay tv movie u just have to press "ok" or your room number. In Regent u are charged by this indirect way. On top of that, when we saw our bills online via tv, the result was zero. At checkout, the clerk insisted we pay 22 Euros (11 per day) JUST FOR BROWSING!!!!Of course we refused to pay for movies we did not see. When we explained that the fair system charges when both sides agree (by e.g. typing "ok" or room number), they replied "that's the system". Of course they knew that we were right and when they saw we were not stupid they gave us a block of paper and asked us to sign that we did not see any pay tv movies. So they did not manage to make full of ourselves. And generally it is an old hotel deeply in need for a renovation. Gives a vivid impression of impoverished and decadent aristocracy. KEEP AWAY!!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel back in July and was in Rome this last weekend. The more reviews I read the more worried I became but I need not have been. The hotel is probably more like a 3 star than the 4 star it is listed as-we found the hotel to be comfortable-the staff we spoke to were all helpful and polite. The breakfast was fine and is complimentary within the price you pay. We payed around 80 euros per night for our room and if you can get it for that sort of price it represents good value for money. It is located in the Parioli district or Rome and to get there you need to get to Flaminio metro station then take the ferrovio urbane one stop to euclide and the hotel is right at the exit of the station. A one day travel card will cost you 4 euros and it wirth getting-also getting to and from the airport you might want to get a bus to ciampino then the train to termini which costs 1 euro for the bus and 2 euros for the train and leaves you right in the centre with metro connections onward-all in all if you want a decent hotel in a good location for a cheap price you will get this at the regent. As for Rome itself you will not be disappointed just be aware that you need to be at the Sistine Chapel by 12:15 during the winter to get in and it is closed on sundays.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We asked for a quiet room and got one, a corner room, but quiet. The shower was tiny, but typical Italian. We only got one set of towels for two days, just how they are in Italy. We did ask for another set, but never received them. Front desk staff were fine. We consulted with the staff on other side of our lobby (Grand Ritz?). The breakfast was nothing to write home about, but sufficed. Its included in the price and you don't have to search for it. Don't expect a lot of service. We stayed there for price, not service. It's a major city and price was our concern since we weren't going to be in the room much. Overall, okay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “It's a low quality two star.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Orrible Hotel!! This is not a four star hotel!!! It's a low quality two star hotel. awful!!! dirty!!! The bed was unusable!!! the breakfast not eatable!!! never again!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't go again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel = 2 stars maximum. We took our 9mth old daughter, and weren't impressed. The travel cot (ok, they supplied one as requested) had no base, so the legs in the middle created a small mountain over which a mattress (of rolled up blankets) was draped. They did replace this with a slightly less bumpy, but rather old cot once we'd complained. They don't have a kettle in the hotel (not even one!), so if you're needing to heat baby bottles, you'll enjoy collecting hot water (in the ice bucket or teapots) from the coffee machine in the hotel bar from the grumpy barman, unless it (the coffee machine) brakes down. We were anticipating walking into the centre of Rome, as we like walking, but the route in is not well lit after dark, and further than we expected (25-35mins to P. del Popolo). We opted for the train mostly but difficult if you're returning to the hotel after they stop running, which seemed to be 22.45 not a problem for us, but maybe useful info. I'd agree with some of the breakfast comments below, but it seems luck of the draw as to whether the staff are helpful/friendly - we had one friendly/helpful breakfast waitress, but mainly not. We had no hot water one morning - we couldn't find out why. And had a group of americans arriving which the hotel seemed unable to deal with, as we tried to leave the hotel with pushchair through a barrage of suitcases. Enjoyed the time in Rome (away from the hotel), but glad to be home :-)

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: patlpoolvl
Reviews.Content: Unlike the some of the recent reviews, we did not find one rude person. EVERYONE that we came in contact with at the hotel were friendly and most helpful. If you go expecting an American or English breakfast you will be let down, however, the buffet provided several types of breakfast pastry, coffee, cereal, cold cuts and fruit. The hotel rooms are normal size for europe, and were clean and well maintained. When we did have a problem during our 8 nights there, they responded quickly and in a very pleasent manner. Rome is a very noisey city, if you want quite go for the upper floors, and ask for one away from the lifts. The location is right next to the tram to the metro station and only cost 1 euro, location was not a problem. By U.S. standards it would be a 3 star, but by what we saw it was in line with 4 star hotels around Rome. I almost let the guest with problems change my decision to stay here, I am glad i did not. We had a very nice stay and our group had 3 rooms. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel BEFORE reading any reviews. BIG mistake !! This hotel was at best a decent 2 star, but nowhere near 3 or 4 star standard. 1.) Advertised as 1 km from 'city centre' but it's in the middle of nowhere, a train journey to the centre of Rome or a 40min walk. 2.) It's the noisiest hotel I have ever stayed in, we were on the 7th floor and the traffic (horns ambulances etc) woke us repeatedly on our first few nights so we bought ear plugs which helped a little bit ! 3.) The breakfast 'buffet' was a disgrace, tinned fruit crawling with flies, orange squash and hard rolls with butter was available together with warm meat and cheese left out at room temp. Service a nightmare despite on one occassion 2 staff for every guest (we counted 10 staff for 3 couples on our last morning) 4.) Advertised as having a gym, but actually there was none. 5.) Staff rude to the point of ignoring 'good mornings' and 'good evenings'. 6.) We paid Eur870 for 6 nights so it wasn't even cheap ! We will never go back and advise anyone we can to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. The only plus point was the location to the metro (euclide) which was at the bottom of the road. Heres what made it so awful: 1. The state of the carpet - it was in bits in some places 2. No coffee/Tea facilities in room. 3. Shower didnt work. 4. Views through the window awful. 5. All the furniture was cheap and chipped. 6. The bed had awful and the springs were gone. 7. No literature whatsover in the room on how the air con worked / dining times etc. 8. Bed sheets had stains on. 9. The windows rattled at night - I had to lodge some paper in them.

Reviews.Title: “Need Better Directions”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: To begin directions on their website to get to the hotel were incorrect! The closest metro station is Euclide, not Flamino. We ended up trying to find the hotel for over an hour and a half (and we do travel quite a bit and know how to read a map). The room was an average European room, nothing special. The bath tub drain was clogged. For Italy the breakfast was not impressive at all, they didn't have hot water for tea (it was more like cold water). The staff was not friendly and it was like we were doing the favor of staying in their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The lobby and the rooms were clean and nice. The hotel is located a bit outside of the city center, but with good access to Flaminio Metro Station from Euclide which is just around the block. The train takes only 2 min. to Flaminio. The breakfast was nothing more than ok and the staff could seem a bit rude. Although the bed was extremely hard and they didnt managed to fix the safe I'm pleased with my stay. The air conditioner worked as it was supposed to do. Look out for pickpockets in Rome, especially the gypsies (small girls and women). They seem to operate on the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “would do it again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our room was not as attractively decorated as the one in the pictures, but the size made up for it! This was a Texas-sized room, largest I've had in Europe. Some very helpful concierges, great English. One concierge was extremely rude, but the others made up for him. Great breakfast as well. No problems with location. There is a metro stop (Euclid, which connects to Flaminio) at the end of the hotel block. This got us everywhere we wanted to go! Rome is big, and the crazy traffic makes walking difficult, so we would have used the metro even if smack in the middle of Rome.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Regent Roma
HotelInfo.Address: Via Filippo Civinini 46, 00197 Rome, Italy (Formerly Quality Hotel Regent)
